Can you check if this is reproducible with the winit example? It's available here: https://github.com/tomaka/winit.

You should be able to test it by running the following command:
`git clone https://github.com/tomaka/winit && cd winit && cargo run --example window`

If this can be reproduced with just the winit example, this should probably be reported upstream in the winit issue tracker. Feel free to open an issue yourself if you can reproduce it, otherwise I'll create one.

issue.title: Alacritty crashes on closing the laptop lid
issue.body:
When closing the laptop lid (which is configured to turn off the screen, but not sleep) alacritty crashes with the following message:

```
~/ $ alacritty
thread 'main' panicked at '[winit] Failed to find any monitors using XRandR.', libcore/option.rs:1008:5
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.
```
> Which operating system does the issue occur on?

Xubuntu 18.04 64 bit

> If on linux, are you using X11 or Wayland?

X11

body: https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/pull/1158 was merged, which should in turn fix this alacritty crash.

issue.title: Update to winit/glutin EventLoop 2.0
issue.body:
This takes the latest glutin master to port Alacritty to the EventLoop
2.0 rework.

This changes a big part of the event loop handling by pushing the event
loop in a separate thread from the renderer and running both in
parallel.

issue.title: Alacritty crashes when no monitors are left
issue.body:
Gentoo Linux X11, Xfwm4, Alacritty 0.4.0

Hello,

when disconnecting all monitors from my laptop and then closing the lid, there is a high probability that all Alacritty windows crash. Curiously, this doesn't seem to happen when I unplug the last monitor *after* closing the lid. Relevant log:

```thread 'main' panicked at 'Failed to update normal hints: XError { description: "BadValue (integer parameter out of range for operation)", error_code: 2, request_code: 12, minor_code: 0 }', src/libcore/result.rs:999:5```

This seems very similar to #1789, but that one was supposedly fixed by EventLoop 2.0, which is present in Alacritty 0.4.0 (isn't it?). I also suspect that #2516 might be the same bug, but I cannot be sure.

Thanks!
